JobFullDesc: POSITION SUMMARY:The role of Sr. Finance Manager Co-Pilot, reporting to the Division Controller, will be responsible for the Domestic Business Unit (Imported Brands) within the Global Brands Division.This Co-Pilot will operate as the key finance lead and strategic business partner to the Domestic Commercial team; partnering with the Pilot to proliferate brands and drive profitable growth for the Division. They will be responsible for leading the short and long term business processes, providing insight and strongly supported fact-based decision making, while also challenging new strategies, new projects and the status quo. The individual must be able to effectively interact, collaborate and communicate across multiple functions in the organization, cooperating and building consensus to drive results. The position will plan, prioritize and manage workload in an environment of competing priorities where risk must be accurately assessed to support and guide timely and sound business decisions. PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES: Counsel for the GM for Domestic Business Lead, coach and inspire a team of two Sr. Analyst, a FMT, along with cross functional partners Allocated limited resources that best delivery consumer demands that drive long term value contribution to brand portfolio Key player in the Monthly Business Planning Process, providing transparency and direction towards target achievement at any time in the process. Facilitate the Dynamic Forecast process Analyze and challenge product portfolio to identify cost optimization opportunities, eliminate Value Destroyers, optimize the mix and maximize the return on investment from Commercial Spend (TTS/PFME including revised pricing structure/prices) Collaborate with Functional Teams (Marketing, Sales, T&P, Supply Chain) and FP&A to drive understanding, generate insights and influence business results Drive E2E focus on optimizing the network and driving cost improvements including structural cost Support Business I&R and strategic growth pipeline including development of End to End capability and capacity to support growth Support special projects: M&A, Sourcing, integration, business transformation Define financial framework for approval of spend (product launch, promotions, campaigns, etc) Work with Functional Finances leads on Forecasting, Closing, Projects, Savings, etc Provide monthly and ad hoc executive summary insights, narrative, trends, variances, risks and opportunities Drive decision making and accountability to achieve financial targets; partner and educate on Value CreationREQUIREMENTS AND MINIMUM EDUCATION LEVEL: BA/BS degree with major in Accounting or Finance Proficiency in use of Microsoft applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access) and working knowledge of Essbase, SAP and B/WPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Willingness to relocate for career advancementEXPERIENCE: Minimum 5-7 years’ experience in Accounting or Finance Management; previous food industry or CPG experience preferred Working knowledge of US Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (US GAAP) and/or International Accounting Standards (IAS), knowledge of Nestle Accountings Standards (NAS) a plus Working knowledge of financial concepts and principles including cost accounting, activity based costing, cash flow, NPV, IRR, ROI, etc Ability to understand and communicate the drivers of product profit and loss Hands-on working knowledge of financial statements, including P&L, balance sheet, and cash flow SKILLS: Ideal candidate is results focused, a self-starter with strong initiative, naturally inquisitive, able to think independently and has a desire to make a difference Strong business acumen, financial and analytical skills; ability to draw conclusions from information and develop recommendations; critically important to be able to deliver the message to non-finance professionals Intermediate to advanced financial modeling Communicate effectively and professionally in written and verbal form, including presentation skills Multi-task; manage/organize time, information and resources effectively in order to meet deadlines and respond to requests in a timely manner Partner with customers/cross-functional teams to drive business results and meet deliverables; ability to influence business decisions with concrete financial support Commitment to first time quality and accuracy in all work Ability to drive change Computer skills: MS Windows including intermediate to advanced Excel, Word, and PowerPoint; Basic Access; Hyperion Essbase, SAP, BW  The Nestlé Companies are an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer seeking diversity in qualified applicants for employment.
